page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = email_send2(P pMessage [,C profile [,L lSilent [,L store_in_mailbox [,L autowrap ]]]])

argument.name: Result_Flag as L =
argument.description: Indicates success or failure after sending an email.

argument.name: pMessage
argument.description: A pointer variable containing the message.

item.name: .To
item.description: A semi-colon (;), comma (,), or CR-LF delimited list of recipients. Microsoft Outlook allows you to format the address as "recipient_name". This hides the "" portion of the field from the recipient.

item.name: .CC
item.description: Optional. The CC list. Multiple entries are separated by commas.

item.name: .BCC
item.description: Optional. The BCC list. Multiple entries are separated by commas.

item.name: .Subject
item.description: The subject line of the email. Optional, depending on mail server requirements.

item.name: .Message
item.description: The body of a text message. Optional, depending on mail server requirements.

item.name: .Html_Message
item.description: Optional. The body of a HTML message.

item.name: .Attachments
item.description: Optional. A semi-colon (;), comma, or CR-LF delimited list of filenames. Any file type can be attached.

item.name: .Xmailer
item.description: Optional. Default = NULL. The sending email program.

item.name: .Lrelated
item.description: Optional. Default = .F. .T. = Attachments are embedded image in the HTML message. .F. = Attachments are separate files.

item.name: .Date
item.description: Optional. Default = "". The date of the email.

item.name: .Failure
item.description: Optional. Default = "". A list of failed addresses.

item.name: .Headers
item.description: Optional. Default = "". If the user wants to supply additional Email headers per RFC822, they can set them in the Headers property.

item.name: .Success
item.description: Optional. Default = "". A list of successful addresses.

item.name: .ReturnReceipt
item.description: Optional. Default = .F. If .t. then an e-mail will be sent to the sender acknowledging that the recipient has read the e-mail. Note that not all e-mail clients support this feature and the recipient might decline to send the receipt.

argument.name: profile
argument.description: Optional. Uses the last active profile. The name of an email profile as found on the View > Settings > Email > Profiles tab. Character

argument.name: lSilent
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. Allows you to trap errors using the Xbasic ON ERROR GOTO command. .T. = Error trapping on. .F. = Error trapping off.

argument.name: store_in_mailbox
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Whether to store the message in your mailbox. .T. = Alpha Anywhere stores a copy of the message in the Alpha Anywhere outbox. .F. = Copy not saved.

argument.name: autowrap
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .T. Whether to force text emails to wrap at 72 characters per line. .T. = Automatically wrap all lines of text at 72 characters or less. .F. = Leave text email body unchanged.

page.discussion: Note : EMAIL_SEND2() requires that you have configured an Alpha Five email profile. If you are working in an environment where this is not possible, use EMAIL_SMTP_OPEN(), EMAIL_SMTP_SEND(), and EMAIL_SMTP_CLOSE(). EMAIL_SEND2() sends an email message using Alpha Anywhere's built-in email features. The function does not require that you have a third party email client (such as Eudora or Outlook ) installed on the computer. Note : EMAIL_SEND() is not sensitive to the type of image files attached and embedded in HTML formatted messages.

section.title: Example
section.description: Sends an email message using A5's internal email facility. A copy of the message is stored in the user's Alpha Anywhere outbox.
section.example: dim message as P body = %a% Just wanted to let you know that we really enjoy using Alpha Five. %a% message.message = body message.to = "sales@alphasoftware.com" message.subject = "Thanks" email_send2(message, "", .F., .T.)

section.description: The Silent option is useful for Xbasic programmers who are using the EMAIL_SEND2() function in a loop where they want to prevent the standard Alpha Anywhere error messages from popping up when an error (such as a bad email address) in encountered. Instead, they want to write their own error handler for this condition. For example:
section.example: Dim tbl as P Dim ITbl as P Tbl = table.open("customers") Query.filter = "balance > 1000000" Query.order = "recno() " ITbl = tbl.query_create() Tbl.fetch_first() While .not. tbl.fetch_eof() ON ERROR GOTO BAD_EMAIL

section.description: Fill in all of the arguments for EMAIL_SEND2() and set the Silent parameter to .T. .
section.example: Email_sends(??????, .t.) ON ERROR GOTO 0 'turn error handler off Tbl.fetch_next() End While Tbl.close() ' end the main script here so that it does not continue into the error handler End BAD_EMAIL: ' put you own error handling code here RESUME NEXT ' causes Alpha Anywhere to resume on the line after email_sends() end

section.description: This example shows how to include an image in an email.
section.example: dim pm as P pm.attachments = " C:\login.jpg " pm.lrelated = .T. pm.from = "aaron@alphasoftware.com" pm.from_alias = "Aaron Brown" pm.to = "aaron@alphasoftware.com" pm.subject = "Inline Attachments" pm.html_message = %html% 'This is a message with an inline image.
